title: StayinFront Congratulates Mondelez Exec Mark Dajani on Consumer Goods Technology CIO of the Year Award
text:
Submitted by admin on 10/22/2015 @ 8:10 AM   StayinFront 
FAIRFIELD, NJ -- (Marketwired) -- 10/22/15 -- StayinFront congratulates Mark Dajani, Chief Information and Process Officer of Mondelēz International, on receiving Consumer Good Technology (CGT) magazine's 2015 CIO of the Year award. Dajani was recognized at the CGT Business & Technology Leadership Conference today in Orlando, Fla., where he was praised for his forward vision and ability to execute. Consumer Goods Technology recently profiled Dajani in its September 2015 cover story, "Empowering Global Growth," which detailed Dajani's role in Mondelēz's Winning in Sales Execution (WiSE) initiative, a multi-year global project designed to transform the selling process of Mondelēz's more than 40,000 sales representatives. 
Dajani, who was Mondelēz's first chief information officer, was also the subject of an Oct. 5 Forbes.com interview, part of the website's CIO-plus series. The article, written by contributor Peter High, noted Dajani's "significant digital and innovation responsibilities," and his "ability to simplify IT" and make Mondelēz "more truly customer-centric." 
The CGT CIO of the Year award is presented annually to the Chief Information Officer who has made the largest demonstrable business impact within his or her consumer goods organization through the implementation and successful use of technology. Nominations are accepted from technology companies, consultants, consumer goods executives, retailers, analysts and partners. 
"WiSE is among the biggest collaborative initiatives ever undertaken by Mondelēz's Sales and IS divisions and Mark was at the forefront of its development and implementation," said Thomas R. Buckley, CEO of StayinFront. "Under Mark's leadership, Mondelēz is working to improve sales processes and execution by leveraging and simplifying technology. We have been privileged to work with Mark over the years -- as well as the great global team he has assembled and manages -- to support him in executing his vision. His recognition by CGT magazine is well deserved." 
Mondelēz International, which until 2012 was known as Kraft Foods, is a $35 billion consumer goods company best known for brands such as Oreo, Cadbury and Nabisco. StayinFront is a global software company committed to developing and delivering leading retail execution mobile cloud solutions to the consumer goods industry. Its products, deployed by companies such as Mondelēz, Kimberly Clark and Energizer, include StayinFront TouchCG ®, StayinFront TouchCG LT and industry acclaimed StayinFront PitchBook®, a dynamic selling tool which allows field representatives to easily launch highly relevant, customized, data driven, multi-media presentations to store buyers. 
About StayinFront StayinFront is a leading global provider of mobile, cloud-based field force effectiveness and customer relationship management solutions for consumer goods and life sciences organizations. Companies of all sizes, in over 50 countries, use StayinFront software to streamline sales operations and reduce the complexity, time and expense associated with field efforts. StayinFront products provide companies with timely, accurate field data and insight, enabling field reps and management to do more, know more and sell more. Headquartered in Fairfield, NJ, USA, StayinFront has offices in Chicago, the United Kingdom, Turkey, Ireland, India, Australia, Singapore and New Zealand. For more details visit www.stayinfront.com .
